newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine stocks seen up, investor demand strong.
newsitem.headline: Argentine stocks seen up, investor demand strong.

text.p: Argentine stocks were expected to continue their winning streak Friday on the back of strong local and foreign demand.
"The market is set to open firm thanks to rising new funds helped by the rising trade volumes," said Augusto Milou, a trader at Galicia Valores.
On Thursday the blue-chip MerVal index .MERV rose 1.75 percent to 836.12, taking the market's gains in the last three sessions to 5.74 percent.
Trade volume on Thursday amounted to 45.8 million pesos.
"The market retains its strong perspectives for the medium-term, although there could be some profit-taking in coming days," said another trader.

Milou said the Argentine market had benefited from instability in Brazilian stocks. "It showed that Argentine fundamentals are stronger, which could lead to arbitrage to Argentine from Brazilian stocks," he said.
